schema.title:
执行目标资源类型：vCPU容量或者执行节点数。取值范围如下：

schema.description:
Target resource type: the capacity of vCPUs or the number of execution nodes. Valid values:

*   VCpuCapacity
*   ExecutorCapacity

schema.title: 执行计划期望的资源规模。如果ResourceType是VcpuCapacity的话，该字段表示执行计划希望保有10000vCPU。
schema.description: The expected scale of resources for the execution plan. If the ResourceType parameter is set to VcpuCapacity, the execution plan is expected to have 10000 vCPUs.

UpdateActionPlan.summary: Adjust the resource scale of the execution plan or modify the execution status

schema.description: The ID of the execution plan.
The expected scale of resources for the execution plan. If the ResourceType parameter is set to VcpuCapacity, the execution plan is expected to have 10000 vCPUs.

Whether to enable the execution plan. Valid values:

*   true: enables the execution plan.

*   false: The execution plan is disabled.

    **

    **Note:** After an execution plan is disabled, the created Instant jobs are not automatically managed by the execution plan.

schema.title: Schema of Response
schema.description: Schema of Response

400.errorMessage: The specified action plan does not exist.

403.errorMessage: The current status of the execution plan does not support this operation. Please try again later.

ListActionPlans.summary: Queries the list of execution plans.

schema.description: The IDs of the execution plans to be queried.

items.description: The ID of the execution plan to be queried.

schema.description: A pagination token.

The maximum number of entries per page.

Valid values: 1 to 100.

Default value: 20.

schema.title: Schema of Response
schema.description: Schema of Response

TotalCount.title: TotalCount本次请求条件下的数据总量，此参数为可选参数，默认可不返回
TotalCount.description: Total data count under the current request conditions (optional; not returned by default).

NextToken.title: 表示当前调用返回读取到的位置，空代表数据已经读取完毕
NextToken.description: Indicates the read position returned by the current call. An empty value means all data has been read.

MaxResults.title: MaxResults本次请求所返回的最大记录条数
MaxResults.description: The maximum number of records returned in this request.

ActionPlans.description: The list of execution plan results.

items.description: The information about the prefetch plans.

Status.description:
The status of the execution plan. The possible values are as follows:

*   Active Instant tasks are dynamically managed only when the execution plan is in the Active state.
*   Inactive Instant tasks are no longer managed by execution plans in the Inactive state.
*   Deleting: The execution plan is being deleted. You cannot modify the parameters of an execution plan in this state.

ActionPlanId.description: The ID of the execution plan.

ActionPlanName.description: The name of the execution plan.

CreateTime.description: The time when the execution plan was created.

UpdateTime.description: The time when the execution plan was last modified. The time follows the ISO 8601 standard and UTC +0. The format is yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mmZ.

400.errorMessage: The specified action plan does not exist.

The implementation status of the execution plan activity. Valid values:

*   InProcess
*   Completed
*   Failed

EndTime.description: The end time of the execution plan activity.

CreatedCapacity.description: The increased capacity of this execution plan activity.

Jobs.description: The list of Instant jobs involved in the execution plan.

items.description: The information about the Instant jobs involved in the execution plan.

JobOperationType.description:
The operation type of the execution plan activity on the job. Possible values are as follows:

*   Create
*   Delete

StartTime.description: The start time of the implementation of the planned activity.

ActionPlanActivityId.description: The activity ID of the execution plan.

DestroyCapacity.description: The capacity released by this execution plan activity.

ResourceType.title:
执行目标资源类型：vCPU容量或者执行节点数。取值范围如下：

- VCpuCapacity：vCPU容量

- ExecutorCapacity：执行节点数
ResourceType.description:
Target resource type: the capacity of vCPUs or the number of execution nodes. Valid values:

*   VCpuCapacity
*   ExecutorCapacity

DesiredCapacity.title: 执行计划期望的资源规模。如果ResourceType是VcpuCapacity的话，该字段表示执行计划希望保有10000vCPU。
DesiredCapacity.description: The expected scale of resources for the execution plan. If the ResourceType parameter is set to VcpuCapacity, the execution plan is expected to have 10000 vCPUs.

TotalCapacity.title: 执行计划当前管理的资源规模。
TotalCapacity.description: The size of the resources currently managed by the execution plan.

Status.title:
执行计划状态，可能值如下：

- Active：生效状态。处于生效状态的执行计划才会动态管理Instant任务。

- Inactive：失效状态。失效状态的执行计划不再管理Instant任务。

- Deleting：执行计划正在删除中。该状态下执行计划不支持修改参数。
Status.description:
The status of the execution plan. The possible values are as follows:

*   Active Instant tasks are dynamically managed only when the execution plan is in the Active state.
*   Inactive Instant tasks are no longer managed by execution plans in the Inactive state.
*   Deleting You cannot modify the parameters of an execution plan in this state.

DeleteActionPlan.title: DeleteActionPlan
DeleteActionPlan.description:
**Make sure that you fully understand E-HPC Instnat billing methods and [prices](https://help.aliyun.com/zh/e-hpc/e-hpc-instant/product-overview/billing-overview?spm=a2c4g.11186623.help-menu-57664.d\_0\_2\_0.5fdd28422y6UvO).**

This operation stops all Instant jobs that are managed by ActionPlanId.

schema.description: The job name. The name must be 2 to 64 characters in length and can contain letters, digits, and Chinese characters. It can contain hyphens (-) and underscores (\_).
The description of the job.
The list of tasks. Only one task is supported.

items.description: The details of the task.

TaskName.description: The job name. It must be 2 to 32 characters in length and can contain letters, digits, and Chinese characters. It can contain hyphens (-) and underscores (\_).

TaskSpec.description: The details of the task specification.

items.description: The task execution configurations.

WorkingDir.description: The working directory of the container.

Command.description:
The container startup commands. You can specify up to 20 commands. Each command can be up to 256 characters in length.

> 

*   If the start command contains spaces (for example, `sleep 60s` ), the input JSON format parameter is `["sleep", "60s"]`.

*   If the startup command is complex, the parameter format may be a combination of `Command: ["/bin/bash"]` and `Arg:["-c", "<customized command>"]`. The `<customized command>` is a user-defined combination of commands and can contain characters such as spaces.

items.description: The content of the container startup command. Each command contains up to 256 characters.

EnvironmentVars.description: The environment variables of the container. A maximum of 20 groups.

items.description: The environment variables of the container.

Name.description: The name of the environment variable for the container. It can be 1 to 128 characters in length. Format requirement: \[0-9a-zA-Z], and underscores, cannot start with a number.

Value.description: The value of the environment variable for the container. The value must be 0 to 256 bits in length.

Arg.description: The startup argument of the init container. A maximum of 10 groups.

items.description: The startup argument of the init container.

PrologScript.description: The pre-processing script. Base64 encoding is required.

Script.description: The running-job script. Base64 encoding is required.

AppId.description: The ID of the virtual machine application.

Password.description:
The logon password of the virtual machine environment. The password must be 8 to 30 characters in length and contain at least three of the following character types: uppercase letters, lowercase letters, digits, and special characters. The following special characters are supported:

()\`~!@#$%^&\*-\_+=|{}\[]:;'<>,.?/ In Windows, the password cannot contain a forward slash (/) as the first character.

> We recommend that you use HTTPS to send requests if you specify Password to avoid password leakage.

VolumeMount.description: The list of data volumes mounted to the task. A maximum of 10 groups.

items.description: The list of data volumes mounted to the task.

MountPath.description:
The directory where the task mounts the data volume.

> The content of the mounted directory is overwritten by the content of the volume. Exercise caution when you use the directory.

VolumeDriver.description:
Currently supported data volume types.

*   alicloud/nas: mounts NAS.
*   alicloud/oss: mounts OSS.

ReadOnly.description: Specifies whether the volume is read-only. Default value: false.

Resource.description: The resource information of the running environment.

Cores.description: The number of CPUs in the running environment.

Memory.description: The memory size of the running environment. Unit: GiB.

items.description: The array of the disks.

Type.description: The type of the disk. Currently, only System is supported, which indicates the system disk.

Size.description: The size of the disk. Unit: GiB.

InstanceTypes.description: The instance type of the running environment. A maximum of 5 groups.

items.description:
The instance type of the running environment.

> This parameter takes effect only when the `DeploymentPolicy. AllocationSpec` parameter is set to `Standard`.

RetryCount.description: The maximum number of retries. Valid values: 1 to 10. Default value: 3.

ExitCodeActions.description: The retry rule. A maximum of 10 groups.

items.description: The retry rule.

ExitCode.description: The task exit code, which is used together with the action to form a job retry rule. Valid values: 0 to 255.

Action.description:
The next step behavior of the task.

*   Retry: The job starts a retry when a specific exit code is hit.
*   Exit: The job exits when a specific exit code is hit.

MaxCount.description:
The maximum number of nodes to run the job.

> Follow the calculation formula: `MaxCount = (IndexEnd - IndexStart) / IndexStep +1`

ArraySpec.description:
The details of the array job. The index value of the sub-job is passed to the running environment through environment variables to support user business program reference. Environment variables include:

*   EHPC_JOB_NAME: the name of the job. This parameter corresponds to the JobName parameter.
*   EHPC_JOB_ID: The ID of the job.
*   EHPC_TASK_NAME: the name of the task. This parameter corresponds to the TaskName parameter.
*   EHPC_EXECUTOR_ID: The ID of the execution unit.
*   EHPC_ARRAY_TASK_ID: the sub-job index value.
*   EHPC_ARRAY_TASK_COUNT: the total number of sub-jobs.
*   EHPC_ARRAY_TASK_MAX: the maximum sub-job index, which corresponds to the IndexStart parameter.
*   EHPC_ARRAY_TASK_MIN: the minimum value of the sub-job index, which corresponds to the IndexEnd parameter.
*   EHPC_ARRAY_TASK_STEP: the index step size of the sub-job, which corresponds to the IndexStep parameter.

IndexStart.description: The starting value of the array job index. Valid values: 0 to 4999.

IndexEnd.description: The end value of the array job index. Valid values: 0 to 4999. The value must be greater than or equal to the value of IndexStart.

IndexStep.description:
The interval of the array job index.

> If the array job property is IndexStart=1,IndexEnd=5, and IndexStep=2, the array job contains three sub-jobs. The index values of the sub-jobs are 1,3, and 5. You can access the sub-jobs by using environment variables.

TaskSustainable.description:
Indicate whether the job is a long-running job.

*   true: background service the job.
*   false: batch jobs.

Default value: false.

schema.description: The resource deployment policy.

AllocationSpec.description:
The resource type,

*   Standard
*   Dedicated: You must enable a whitelist for use.
*   Economic: You must enable a whitelist for use.

items.description: The ID of the VSwitch.

EnableExternalIpAddress.description:
Whether the job creates a public IP address.

*   true: creates a public IP address.
*   false: does not create a public IP address.

Default value: false.

Tag.description: The tag information of the job. A maximum of 20 groups.

items.description: The tag information of the job.

Key.description: The key of the job tag. The tag key cannot be an empty string. The tag key can be up to 128 characters in length and cannot contain http:// or https://. The tag key cannot start with acs: or aliyun.

Value.description: The value of the job tag. You can specify empty strings as tag values. The tag value can be up to 128 characters in length and cannot contain http:// or https://.

Pool.description: The resource pool of the job.

Priority.description: The priorities of the jobs. A larger value indicates a higher job scheduling priority. Valid values: 1 to 100.

Level.description:
The computing power level. This value is valid only when the resource type is Economic. The following disk categories are supported:

*   General
*   Performance

Default value: General.

schema.description: The security policy.

SecurityGroupIds.description: The array of security group IDs.

items.description: The ID of the security group.

schema.description: Dependency policy.

JobDependency.description: The job dependency. A maximum of 10 groups.

items.description: The job dependency.

Type.description:
The type of the dependency. Valid values:

*   AfterSucceeded: **All subtasks** of the dependent job or array job succeed. The exit code is 0.
*   AfterFailed: **All subtasks** of the dependent job or array job fail. The exit code is not 0.
*   AfterAny: The dependent job completes (succeeds or fails).
*   AfterCorresponding: The subtask corresponding to the dependent array job succeeds. The exit code is 0.

Default value: AfterSucceeded.

schema.title: Schema of Response
schema.description: Schema of Response

items.description: The details of the task list.

ExecutorIds.description: The list of executor IDs contained in the task.

items.description: The ID of the executor. The format is JobId-TaskName-ArrayIndex.

The maximum number of instances in a security group is exceeded.
Insufficient resource quota.

The security group does not exist.

GetJob.summary: Obtains the details of an execution job.

schema.description: The ID of the job.

schema.title: Schema of Response
schema.description: Schema of Response

Tasks.description: The list of tasks. Only one task is supported.

items.description: The list of tasks. Only one task is supported.

TaskSpec.description: The details of the task specification.

items.description: The task execution configurations.

PrologScript.description: The pre-processing script. Base64 encoding is required.

Script.description: The running-job script. Base64 encoding is required.

Cores.description: The number of CPUs on which the job is run.

items.description: The array of the disks.

Type.description:
The type of the disk. The following disk categories are supported:

*   System: system disk.
*   Data: data disk.

MaxCount.description: The maximum number of nodes to run the job.

ArraySpec.description: The details of the array job.

IndexStart.description: The starting value of the array job index. Valid values: 0 to 4999.

IndexEnd.description: The end value of the array job index. Valid values: 0 to 4999. The value must be greater than or equal to the value of IndexStart.

IndexStep.description:
The interval of the array job index.

> If the array job property is IndexStart=1,IndexEnd=5, and IndexStep=2, the array job contains three subtasks. The values of the subtask indexes are 1,3, and 5.

TaskSustainable.description: Indicate whether the job is a long-running job.

ExecutorStatus.description: The execution status of the task.

items.description: The execution status of the task.

StatusReason.description: The reason why the stack instance is in the OUTDATED state.

CreateTime.description: The time when the job was created.

StartTime.description: The start time of the scaling plan job.

EndTime.description: The end time of the scaling plan job.

AllocationSpec.description: The type of the resource. Only Dedicated is supported. You must enable a whitelist.

items.description: The ID of the VSwitch.

EnableExternalIpAddress.description:
Whether to create a public IP address.

Valid values:

*   false: false.
*   true: true.

EnableENIMapping.description:
Whether the resource is created in the zone corresponding to the passed-in VSwitch parameter.

*   true: The resource is created in the zone corresponding to the passed-in VSwitch parameter.
*   false: The resource is created in any zone that has resources.

items.description: The list of job tags.

TagKey.description: The key of the job tag.

TagValue.description: The value of the job tag.

Level.description:
The computing power level. The following disk categories are supported:

*   General
*   Performance

Default value: General

CreateTime.description: The time when the job was submitted.

StartTime.description: The time when the job started.

EndTime.description: The time when the job is complete.

Status.description:
The job status. Valid values:

*   Pending: The job is being queued.
*   Initing: The job is being initialized.
*   Succeed: The job is successfully run.
*   Failed: The job failed to run.
*   Running: The job is running.
*   Exception: scheduling exception
*   Retrying: The job is being retried.
*   Expired: The job timed out.
*   Deleted: The job is deleted.
*   Suspended: job hibernation
*   Restarting: The job is being restarted.

AppExtraInfo.description: The additional information about the application.

400.errorMessage: The specified job id is not found.

406.errorMessage: A database error occurred.

503.errorMessage: The request has failed due to a temporary failure of the server.

schema.description:
The name of the resource pool.

*   The name can be up to 15 characters in length.
*   It can contain digits, uppercase letters, lowercase letters, underscores (\_), and dots (.).

The priority of the resource pool.

*   You can set a priority in the range of 1 to 99. The default value is 1, which is the lowest priority.
*   Jobs submitted to a resource pool with a higher priority level value will be scheduled before pending jobs in a resource pool with a lower priority level value, and the priority level of the resource pool takes precedence over the priority of the job.
The quota of resources that users are allowed to concurrently use in a resource pool.

MaxExectorNum.description: The maximum number of concurrent execution nodes in a resource pool.

PoolInfo.description: The information about the resource pool.

PoolName.description:
The name of the resource group.

*   The value can be up to 15 characters in length.
*   It can contain digits, uppercase letters, lowercase letters, underscores (\_), and dots (.).

Status.description:
The status of the resource pool. Valid values:

*   Creating: The resource pool is being created.
*   Updating: The resource pool is being updated.
*   Deleting: The resource pool is being deleted.
*   Working: The resource pool is working.
*   Deleted: The resource pool is deleted.

IsDefault.description:
Indices whether the resource pool is the default resource pool. Valid values:

*   **true**
*   **false**

Priority.description:
The priority of the resource pool.

*   You can set a priority in the range of 1 to 99. The default value is 1, which is the lowest priority.
*   Jobs submitted to a resource pool with a higher priority level value will be scheduled before pending jobs in a resource pool with a lower priority level value, and the priority level of the resource pool takes precedence over the priority of the job.

MaxExectorNum.description: The maximum number of execution nodes that can run concurrently in a resource pool.

ExectorUsage.description: The usage of execution nodes that are running in a resource pool.

CreateTime.description: The time when the resource pool is created.

UpdateTime.description: The time when the resource pool was updated.
